body: @marco-c `True` and `False` are the tracking flags that were filed from the start?
Can you give an example of the kind of bug you are talking about?
Finding the examples is part of fixing this. You'll need to find bugs where a cf_tracking_firefox* flag was there from the beginning, rather than just looking at the history.

Could you verify.If this example is correct?
https://gist.github.com/kushagra414/3080414168d23e61a07bca69d28cbe8c#file-track_bug-json-L12

body:
> Could you verify.If this example is correct?
> https://gist.github.com/kushagra414/3080414168d23e61a07bca69d28cbe8c#file-track_bug-json-L12

It isn't correct, this is an example of what we are already handling (bug filed with no tracking flags, tracking flags added later).

body:
In the Previous PR, I did not run **pre-commit** and the lint task failed.
By mistake, I completely _deleted_ that branch.
That's why I created this new PR. Sorry for the mistake.
But I am new at this. So please forgive me.
There is no need to create a new PR for every change you make, you can simply update an already existing PR.
I updated the existing PR. Please Review
